definition: to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: Youth have been out of danger by the emergency, but his right hand was cut off tesujis, probably will be disabled.
sentences.chinese: 經急救少年已脫險，但右手手筋被砍斷，恐將殘廢。

sentences.english: They praised God for their safe deliverance from the difficult position.
sentences.chinese: 他們讚頌上帝使他們從困境中安全脫險。

sentences.english: The militant has been the policeman tackled, children safe from danger.
sentences.chinese: 綁匪已經被警察擒獲，孩子們安全脫險了。

sentences.english: Marius and Jean Valjean would have stood a chance of extricating themselves singly.
sentences.chinese: 如果馬呂斯和冉阿讓是單個走過去，則還有可能脫險。

sentences.english: Kidnappers have been captured by the police, the children a safe escape.
sentences.chinese: 綁匪已經被警察擒獲，孩子們安全脫險了。

sentences.english: Prime Minister Xanana Gusmao was also targeted by renegades on the same, but escaped unharmed.
sentences.chinese: 總理古斯芒同樣也遭到叛軍襲擊，但成功脫險。

sentences.english: The captain signaled the lifeboat that the ship was out of danger.
sentences.chinese: 船長向救生艇作該船已脫險的信號。

sentences.english: At this point, if the emergency package in the next, you will be out of danger plays an important role.
sentences.chinese: 此時，如果應急包在身旁，將會爲你脫險起很大作用。

sentences.english: He was lucky to come through the war.
sentences.chinese: 他很幸運地從戰爭中脫險。

sentences.english: Wounded as he himself was, he still tried to help others to safety.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他自己受傷了，但他還是盡力幫助別人脫險。

sentences.english: Chinese chef working in Taj Hotel also survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 一名泰姬瑪哈酒店內的中國廚師也已平安脫險。

sentences.english: The pilot was credited with safely landing the aircraft in the Hudson and helping evacuate the seven passengers.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員成功降機在哈得孫河面上並幫助7名乘客脫險。

sentences.english: But Liukin came through when it counted, and is now an Olympic champion.
sentences.chinese: 但是柳金在打分中成功脫險，現在成爲了奧運冠軍。

sentences.english: They escaped with minor injuries but the van was a write-off.
sentences.chinese: 他們受了點輕傷脫險，可是客貨車卻報廢了。

definition: to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
to turn a blind eye to
